steps.title: Recognize Shock Signs
steps.subtitle: Check for rapid pulse, pale skin, confusion, decreased blood pressure.

steps.title: Position Patient
steps.subtitle: Place patient supine, elevate legs 8â€“12 inches if no spinal injury.

steps.title: Control Bleeding
steps.subtitle: Stop any visible bleeding immediately using direct pressure.

steps.title: Maintain Airway
steps.subtitle: Ensure open airway, provide oxygen if available.

steps.title: Prevent Heat Loss
steps.subtitle: Cover patient with blankets, maintain normal body temperature.

steps.title: Monitor Vitals
steps.subtitle: Continuously monitor pulse, breathing, and level of consciousness.
